Please using this api: PrintWriter.write. Answer: To retrieve the output file content like the one you provided, you can use the `PrintWriter.write()` method. This method writes the string representation of an object to the file. Here is how you can modify your code: ```java File input = new File(filePath); PrintWriter writer = new PrintWriter(input, "UTF-8"); writer.write(document.getElementById("1").outerHtml() + "\n"); writer.write(document.getElementById("1").nextSibling().toString() + "\n"); // Retrieve the next sibling element writer.write(document.getElementsByClass("class1").outerHtml() + "\n"); writer.write(document.getElementsByClass("class2").outerHtml() + "\n"); writer.flush(); writer.close(); ``` In this code, `document.getElementById("1").nextSibling().toString()` is used to retrieve the next sibling element of the element with id "1". The `toString()` method is used to convert the `org.jsoup.nodes.Node` object to a string. This will give you the script tag and its content. Please note that this code assumes that the script tag is the next sibling of the div with id "1". If the script tag is located somewhere else, you may need to adjust the code accordingly. Also, ensure that the file path you provide is valid and the file is writable. This should give you the desired output file content. ```html
